subject: Philosophy
title: Democritus and the Atom
description: A micro-lesson that makes Democritus and the Atom usable.

hook.text: Twenty-four centuries before modern physics, a Greek philosopher guessed that everything is made of atoms.

buildup.text: Democritus proposed that reality consists of indivisible particles â€” atomos â€” moving through empty space.

discovery.text: Different arrangements of atoms create everything: wood, water, flesh, stone â€” all from the same tiny particles.

twist.text: He had no microscope, no experiments, no tools. Pure reasoning led him to a truth science confirmed millennia later.

climax.text: Plato reportedly wanted to burn Democritus's books. Atomism threatened the idea of a purposeful universe.

punchline.text: He guessed the truth two thousand years early.

quiz.question: What did Democritus propose about the nature of reality?
